sections.title: PEEK partial dentures in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body: Lightweight, metal-free partial dentures made from PEEK for a warm feel, discreet clasps, and balanced support.
bullets: Metal-free frameworks that feel warm in the mouth
Discreet clasps coloured to blend with teeth
Balanced design to protect supporting teeth
Clear guidance on fit, care, and limitations

sections.title: Lightweight strength with careful planning
items: High-performance polymer that avoids metal taste
Custom clasps shaped to share forces gently
Design reviews to balance slimness with durability
Honest chat about when PEEK is and isn’t ideal
Follow-up adjustments if fit changes over time

sections.title: Metal-free partials with a natural feel
sections.body: PEEK dentures use a tooth-coloured polymer framework instead of metal. We design clasp shapes, tooth positions, and bite with you, then test comfort before finishing so you know how the material behaves.
bullets: Assessment of supporting teeth, gums, and bite
Framework planning to keep bulk low while staying strong
Try-ins to check speech and smile line
Discussion of shade matching for clasps and teeth
Guidance on when acrylic or chrome may be better

sections.title: For patients wanting metal-free stability
items: People sensitive to metal taste or appearance
Patients wanting discreet clasps that blend in
Those preferring a lighter feel than chrome
Patients open to staged fittings for precision
Wearers exploring fit before considering implant stabilisation

sections.title: Designed for comfort and discretion
items: Consultation to map goals and assess supporting teeth
Records for framework design and shade selection
Try-in to review fit, speech, and smile line
Final fit with bite checks and clasp tuning
Guidance on cleaning to protect the polymer surface
Follow-up to review retention and comfort
sections.strapline: You’ll know how PEEK feels and behaves before you commit.

sections.title: Metal-free support with balanced flexibility
sections.body: PEEK frameworks are strong yet slightly flexible, helping clasps hug teeth gently. We tune bite, polish contact points, and explain how adhesives or implant support could help if you want even more stability.

sections.title: Looking after PEEK dentures
items: Daily cleaning to avoid scratching the polymer
Careful storage away from high heat
Regular checks to ensure clasps stay comfortable
Advice on expected movement with removable options
Discussion of alternatives if heavy forces or grinding are present

faqs.question: How does PEEK feel compared to metal?
faqs.answer: It feels warm and lightweight with no metal taste. We still plan a settling-in period and review points for adjustments.

faqs.question: Can PEEK clasps be tooth coloured?
faqs.answer: Yes. We colour-match clasps where possible so they blend with neighbouring teeth.

faqs.question: Is PEEK as strong as chrome?
faqs.answer: PEEK is strong but slightly flexible. It suits many partials, but for very heavy bites or minimal tooth support we may advise chrome or another approach.

faqs.question: What if I want more stability later?
faqs.answer: We can revisit fit, add a soft liner, or discuss implant support if you’d like even less movement. Each step is paced around comfort and healing.

sections.title: Plan discreet PEEK partial dentures
sections.body: Book a consultation to explore PEEK’s metal-free feel with clear guidance on fit, care, and future stabilisation options if you need them.
